Not Mary J!! This is not Mary J. Blige! She went to London for inspiration and seems

Mary is back and I'm loving it. This album is fantastic. It's her best album that truely recognizes her 
talent.This album is fantastic. It's her best album that truly recognizes 
her talent. I DON'T UNDERSTAND WHY ANYONE WOULD GIVE THIS A 1 STAR RATING, 
it deserves a 5. If artists always stay the same, nothing would set them 
apart and MARY explored new ways to bring us that awesome soul and R&B. I 
loved every song on this album and think she delivered what all the Mary 
fans needed after so long. She has outlasted so many other artists and I 
would put her as the number one artist right now. Her music is more genuine 
than all the pop/R&B that puts out all these songs that sound the same. She 
broke through barriers with this album and I am proud of her and I feel her 
struggles. Haters can aboutface on that!

The Best in the Business Honestly, when I looked at the ratings, I wondered how some people could 
not give her 5 stars. Her music has been in my ears since "What's the 
411?", and I don't plan to stop anytime soon. I love you Mary!

Enjoying a different sound Some folks have disliked this saying this isn't the Mary they're used to. 
An artist can't call themselves an artist if they are doing the same thing 
all of the time. Thank you Mary for exploring new facets of your artistry.

Beautiful Compilation Mary was the first artist that really grabbed my attention back with "

Unpredictable Mary J. Was so remarkable w/her approach to this album. Thinking outside

The London Sessions I think she reinvented herself and switched it up a little. Never the less

This album has brought me through so many times. Love it

Astonishing. Yesterday I bought the physical copy from best buy. The case and art work 
itself is beautiful, not to mention that the music is also stunning. It's a 
very mature album and a very wise follow up from Ultraviolence. I wouldn't 
give any advice to improve the album, other than maybe putting all of the 
lyrics, from every track, inside the booklet. My favorite songs are 
definitely Honeymoon, and Freak. Well done Lana you have slayed me again (:

Bittersweet Honeymoon Full of romanticism and quite atmospheric. Moody with plenty of 
interesting string instrumentation. Later tracks are more trap and hip hop 
driven, but the stark contrast adds to the overall color, which is blue. 
Blue is a recurring theme throughout the entire track list. This album 
takes steps away from Ultraviolence in that instead of building a narrative 
around dark, bleak, bombastic, indie rock instrumentals each track swells 
and floats dreamily on the sweeping strings, and luxurious sounding trills.

Honeymoon' may just be Lana Del Rey's best album (so far). It's got a 
noir-ish mixed with jazz mixed with pop kind of sound to it, and it's 
magnificent! This album may not appeal to those who were drawn in by the 
commercial sound of Lana's debut album, 'Born to Die," and that's not 
necessarily a bad thing, because Lana has created a piece of art with this 
album. Lana Del Rey isn't just some ordinary pop star, and that's what 
makes her brilliant. She's deviated from the commercial sound that was 
wanted of

AN AMAZING ALBUM This album slays! Lana has her own beautiful specific genre of music, and 
Honeymoon is no exception. Very romantic sounding, with blues, jazz and 
futuristic sounds intertwined. Seriously the queen of alt Her collab with 
The Weeknd is also fricking wicked!!!

AMAZING OMG lana never fails to amaze me. Her voice just radiates a 60's vibe and I 
love it. Its so unique and I know she'll continue to make amazing music. 
Honestly Lana could spit on me and I'd be like "YASS LANA SLAY ME"

Stunning Lana Del Rey is a very special artist, she has put so much thought and 
emotion into her songs. Each song gets better and better, then you reach 
the end of the album in pure awe. Great job yet again!

Amazing album! I brought this album the day it came out. This womans song lyrics in this 
whole album is just amazing! Her voice singing the lyrics accompanying with 
the beats is definitely out of this world! Once again LDR did it again. 
Great music and worth every cent you pay for it. Always and will be a huge 
fan of her and her music.

She's not the same When Lana first started making music, it was true and great. Now, she's 
making more music that is what people want to hear instead of her original 
type. It doesn't really even sound the same anymore. I'm disappointed with 
this album, and most people who have listened to her since the beginning 
agree that she is just not as good anymore.

Lana is back I have to admit I was really disappointed with her last album 
Ultraviolence. I was hesitant to buy this album because of that. I think 
anyone who is a fan will not regret getting this. I can't stop listening to 
Salvatore!!

The worst of the best Not a genere artist, but a class on its own. This is what the greatest 
have in common. For me, not as good as her previous albums, but one of the 
most important of the year. I bought the CD.

Repetitive I ADORED Ultraviolence. I was hoping to love this as well, but was not 
really impressed on the whole with this album. I gave it another listen. 
And another. And I could not ignore the fact that there were multiple songs 
which I was done listening to before they ended. There are a few good 
tracks, but Honeymoon is not as listenable as an album as Lana's other 
work. It gets too repetitive for my taste. Worth a buy if it goes on sale, 
but I bought it full price because I was so excited for more Lana.

I haven't heard the majority of these, besides Music To Watch Boys To, High 
By The Beach, Terrance loves you, and of course Honeymoon. These released 
are amazing, the one thing I didn't like was the slowness of Honeymoon. I 
have pre ordered the album and will revise this when it comes in.

Lana continues to croon Her voice is even better than on ultraviolence, and she's less sad as 
well. With more beats to back up her caramel smooth lyrics, Lana hit a home 
run.

I have been in love with Lana ever since before Born to Die came out and 
have been with her ever since! I honestly cannot get enough of her music, 
and nobody comes close to the way she sings and expresses the way she feels 
through music. I really know I'm going to love this album just form the 
sampler and songs' she has already released.

Typical Lana Del Rey Music to watch boys to, 24, Honeymoon, & God Knows I Tried are my 
favorites besides the obvious High By The Beach. Like em. I know this is 
her style but i just wish Lana would put out something a little more upbeat 
for a change.

Amazing so far Terrence Loves You and Honeymoon are amazing songs with eloquent lyrics 
and mesmerizing sounds. High By The Beach has more of a trap beat and 
although the song does talk about...well, getting high by the beach, the 
meaning of the lyrics is also pretty valid so don't let the title/chorus 
deceive you. The entire album is excellent so far but my favorite song, as 
of the 3 we can hear right now, is Terrence Loves You and I can't wait to 
hear the rest!

Perfection I've been here since 2012 for Born To Die and also in 2014 for 
Ultraviolence and now in 2015 for Honeymoon. As I even write this I'm 
listening to Terrence Loves You, and the honeymoon hotline is such an 
intelligent and loving thing

Masterpiece! I think this is the best album I've herd in years!! It's so complex and 
sophisticated just a mature album I'm inlove with it, it brought tears to 
my eyes. It's everything I ever wanted in a album!! Keep it up.

Lana has done it again I am a HUGE Lana Del Rey fan.And as much as I loved Ultraviolence, I 
really wanted something like Born To Die. And while this is like Born to 
Die,it isn't like anything else she's ever done. And it is AMAZING! This 
album is so freaking good I can't even express how in love I am with this. 
WAAY better than Ultraviolence

QUEEN I aLREADY KNOW THIS ALBUM IS GONNA SLAY MY EXISTENCE! IM GONNA BE

My bae!! Omg heard her sampler vid that she uploaded on YouTube and already love

Miss Del Rey has done it again! Honeymoon is a masterpiece. Classic Lana shines through in tracks like 
"Art Deco" and "High by the Beach" and her brilliant Noir Style of "The 
Blackest Day" "God Knows I Tried" and "Music to Watch Boys To" take you 
away to another time and place, perhaps 1940's L.A. Immerse yourself in her 
music, allow yourself to get lost, and enjoy the ride!

Better than radio hits When artist make music for the soul and not for hits on the radio you 
learn to apreciate who they are bc they make music from their soul and not 
just to make a catchy tune for more polularity been a fan since she was

Thrive CASTING CROWNS Loved this album great lyrics and great beat with it too!! Modern worship 
is what are churches are lacking!! Treat yourself purchase today you won't 
regret it!! Happy Christmas TO ARE SAVIOUR AND KING!! May God continue to 
bless you casting CROWNS as you are awesome in music and lyrics! Your album 
Casting Crowns speaks to me especially the one about a flower dying it is 
an awesome song keep it up! Love in Christ Some glorious day we will meet!!

Broken together Best song ever!!!! We all feel this way sometime in our life! I also think 
of my adult children and the struggles they have had at different times. 
This song makes me cry because I know we just have to give our trials and 
tribulations over to the Lord. He will heal us, we just have to pray!

This album packs a Spiritual punch! Casting Crowns has always answered Christ commission to "feed my Sheep" 
but 2014's Thrive takes their musical pastoral ministry to new pastures 
with songs that cut to the quick yet speak Truth in love. "Waiting on the 
Night to Fall" is a musical ballad unlike any I've heard thus far. The song 
gently rebukes us for relegating God's scarlet letter to nothing more than 
a dusty Tome on a shelf. This album is worth picking up and listening to 
intently.

Wonderful cd Have a little for everyone But this album is amazing. I have been going 
great through a rough spot and broken together just brings tears to my eyes 
and makes me know that I'm not the only one that has walked this road. 
Thank you Casting Crowns

Great encouragements from Biblical texts Using the Bible as a foundation, Casting Crowns have once again put 
together an album with the wonderful gifts God has given them that is 
truthful, down-to-earth, and that brings the Gospel to life. Their songs 
are lyrically deep and real, and their music moves you to feel the true 
impact that your faith has on your life on this earth. I highly recommend 
this album for anyone, especially if you have been through suffering or 
felt confused by the things that happen in this world.

Broken Together Will always love Casting Crowns. Praying for Mark as he goes through his 
surgery. I heard Broken Together for the first time the day after I had a 
bad break up. God really healed my heart. Bless them Lord like they bless 
us.

Thrive By Casting Crowns is one of the best ever! "Just be held" helps me get 
through a day of rushing and craziness and reminds me I'm not alone in this 
journey, I can't do it all, sometimes I need to "just be held" and let God 
do the rest!

Broken together The lyrics of this song grabbed ahold of my heart when I realized that 
with God's help, my husband and I can be: "broken" & "together"!! I'm 
sending my gratitude to Casting Crowns for these beautiful lyrics...and to 
God be the Glory that He can keep us "together" despite our "brokenness" 1 
Thess. 2:16

Amazing! I have everyday struggles and this album really speaks to me. Actually as 
I was just thinking about how today was horrible "Just Be Held" came on. Im 
in awe of my incredible God. Great Album! Keep up the good work!

Follow me- Casting Crowns This song truely speaks of me, I have never felt loved, Because my mother 
never wanted me and made no bones about it. This song revealed what that 
"Little Girl inside me has always wanted to say, God has given me hope when 
I could not any, and follow me allowed that Little speak for the first time 
! Thank-you, from that little girl!!

Stop holdin' on... And "Just Be Held"! I'm going through a tough, bad breakup. This song came 
on while I was crying the other day. Jesus, thank You for bringing me back 
into the light! I need to stop holdin' on to what's become toxic in my 
life, and just let You hold me. In Jesus name! <3

Broken Together Some songs just draw out the deep quiet voice inside us that whispers how 
much we are broken, but there's hope in God's redemption in Yeshua/Jesus 
the Christ. This is one of those songs...

Praise God It strengthens me and many others to be reminded that we are not alone. 
These singers and all their fans are standing alongside us, standing strong 
and praising our Lord Jesus through the storm of this world. This album is 
amazing and faith-strengthening and just great to listen to. For all who 
read this you are not alone, we are standing next to you reminding you that 
no matter what is thrown at you, God is good. Remember, we are not alone, 
we have each other and even more, we have God. Praise God!

Triciapv226 All about That Bass is the jam! Size acceptance, self esteem, self 
acceptance, and pride are all trumpeted in that song. Teaching kids of all 
sizes, colors and types that if someone doesn't accept you for you, "than 
go ahead and move along" is a strong message. The second and third songs 
are ok. Close your eyes could be a hit.

Love Meghan trainor Meghan Trainor incorporates everything I love in these songs, especially

the songs. 1. Dear Future Husband 2. Title 3. All About That Bass (and) 4. 
Close Your Eyes (being at the bottom because I haven't heard it yet)

Amazing! As a woman who needs special attention to feel good, I was always afraid 
of looking inside myself and finding absolutely nothing. But thanks to 
these great songs, I know that all my problems are actually my boyfriends 
fault! Everyone is obligated to love me and tell me I'm pretty, regardless 
of the fact that I am slowly killing my wonderfully healthy 300kg body. I 
am perfect. Thanks Meghan!

Such a "catchy" little album!! From what I hear just by listening to these few previews, this girl has 
got it all! She's definitely not afraid of rejection & could care less who 
likes her & who doesnt...with that being said, I am a fan! She has an 
oldies vibe to her, but her lyrics are definitely in this time & era! You 
should definitely 'feel' her music & get in her "groove"! Really like her & 
her style.Very different! Hoping that there is more of her & much more of 
her unique talent! Come on with this album...can't wait to hear more!!!

Truly love theses songs! She is so inspirational and has a beautiful voice. I love how her songs

Fit the Mold, I suppose Overall, very bland and unimaginative. Unsigned bands have more talent 
lyrically and instrumentally, and its sad to hear this as popular instead. 
Furthermore, this woman is doing nothing but sending bad messages. 
Conforming to patriarchal stereotypes does not make for a good life lesson. 
Nor does hating on someone for being skinny (or fat). Why not just accept 
people and listen to good music? TL'DR: Sad I can't give zero stars.
